title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: hischooldata package provides simple interface accessing Hawaii public school enrollment data Hawaii Department Education (HIDOE) Hawaii State Department Business, Economic Development & Tourism (DBEDT) State Data Book.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Unlike U.S. states, Hawaii single statewide school district. Hawaii Department Education operates public schools across entire state, organized four counties: Honolulu (Oahu) - approximately 62% total enrollment Hawaii County (Big Island) - approximately 13% enrollment Maui (includes Molokai Lanai) - approximately 11% enrollment Kauai - approximately 5% enrollment Charter Schools - approximately 8% enrollment (statewide) single-district structure means data naturally organized county level rather school district level found states.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: main function fetch_enr(), downloads enrollment data specific school year:
code: library(hischooldata)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024) head(enr_2024)

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: end_year parameter represents END school year: end_year = 2024 means 2023-24 school year (ending June 2024) end_year = 2025 means 2024-25 school year (ending June 2025) convention consistent state schooldata packages.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Use get_available_years() see years available: Note: School year 2011-12 (end_year = 2012) available 2011 DBEDT State Data Book published.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: returned data frame includes:

title: Introduction to hischooldata
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # Get recent years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # Calculate county totals over time county_trends <- enr_multi |>   filter(agg_level == "COUNTY", grade == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, county_name, enrollment)  # Plot trends ggplot(county_trends, aes(x = end_year, y = enrollment, color = county_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Hawaii Public School Enrollment by County",     x = "School Year End",     y = "Total Enrollment",     color = "County"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to hischooldata
code: # Get state-level enrollment by grade enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024) state_grades <- enr_2024 |>   filter(county_name == "State Total", grade != "TOTAL") |>   mutate(grade = factor(grade, levels = c("PK", "K", sprintf("%02d", 1:12), "SPED")))  # Plot grade distribution ggplot(state_grades, aes(x = grade, y = enrollment)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   labs(     title = "Hawaii Public School Enrollment by Grade (2023-24)",     x = "Grade Level",     y = "Enrollment"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: package caches downloaded data locally avoid repeated downloads:
code: # Check cache status cache_status()  # Clear cache for a specific year clear_cache(2024)  # Clear all cached data clear_cache()

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: package fetches data : URL: https://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/economic/databook/ Contains county-level enrollment grade URL: https://www.hawaiipublicschools.org/ Contains school-level detail (available)

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: 2011-12 Data: 2011 DBEDT Data Book published, end_year = 2012 available. SPED Data: Special Education enrollment shown separately years suppressed 2024-25 data (per 2024 Data Book footnote). Multi-Year Tables: 2021 Data Book contains 2020-21 2021-22 school year data. package handles extraction correct year. COVID Impact: 2019 2020 Data Books contain 2019-20 school year data (2020 Data Book duplicate due COVID disruptions).

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Python package also available accessing data: See pyhischooldata/ directory Python implementation.
code: # pip install hischooldata  from hischooldata import fetch_enr  df = fetch_enr(2024) print(df.head())

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {hischooldata: Hawaii School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/hischooldata/}, }

title: Hawaii School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Hawaii school enrollment data Hawaii Department Education (HIDOE) R Python.

what: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: 15 years enrollment data (2010-2025). 180,000 students today. One statewide district. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 1. Hawaii is America’s only statewide school district
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Unlike every state, Hawaii operates single statewide school district approximately 290 schools. local school boards, property tax funding. One state, one system.
code: library(hischooldata) library(dplyr)  enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 2. Enrollment has been declining for a decade
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii lost 15,000 students since 2015. High housing costs push families mainland, birth rates falling.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 3. The most diverse state in America
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii racial majority. Filipino, Native Hawaiian, White, Japanese students comprise significant portions enrollment. true diversity.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("asian", "hawaiian", "white", "hispanic", "multiracial")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: pandemic struck, families Oahu fled mainland shifted private schools. Neighbor island schools resilient.
code: enr %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2020, 2021), grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   group_by(complex_area, end_year) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n) %>%   mutate(change_pct = (`2021` - `2020`) / `2020` * 100)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 5. Kindergarten is shrinking faster than high school
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii’s kindergarten enrollment dropped 20% since 2015. pipeline students entering system narrowing.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "09", "12")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii one highest private school enrollment rates nation. Kamehameha Schools, Punahou, Iolani draw thousands students might otherwise attend public schools.
code: # Public enrollment as context enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   pull(n_students) # Compare to ~35,000 private school students statewide

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 7. The Complex Area system creates mini-districts
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii organizes 290 schools 15 Complex Areas, centered around high school. Complex Areas serve students entire rural districts mainland.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   group_by(complex_area) %>%   summarize(students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(students))

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Oahu loses students, Maui, Big Island, Kauai schools remained stable. Rural Hawaii emptying like rural mainland states.
code: enr %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   mutate(island = case_when(     grepl("Maui|Molokai|Lanai", complex_area) ~ "Maui County",     grepl("Hawaii|Kona|Kohala|Hilo", complex_area) ~ "Big Island",     grepl("Kauai", complex_area) ~ "Kauai",     TRUE ~ "Oahu"   )) %>%   group_by(end_year, island) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii provides special education services 18,000 students, reflecting strong identification service systems.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "special_ed") %>%   select(n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Hawaii’s English Learner population includes students Philippines, Micronesia, Japan, reflecting state’s unique Pacific location.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

title: Hawaii School Data
code: library(hischooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # Statewide totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Complex Area breakdown enr_2024 %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   group_by(complex_area) %>%   summarize(students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(students))  # School-level detail enr_2024 %>%   filter(subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(school_name, complex_area, n_students)

title: Hawaii School Data
code: import pyhischooldata as hi  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = hi.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent = hi.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # Statewide totals enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # Complex Area breakdown (enr_2024[     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') ] .groupby('complex_area')['n_students'] .sum() .sort_values(ascending=False))  # School-level detail (enr_2024[     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ] .sort_values('n_students', ascending=False) [['school_name', 'complex_area', 'n_students']])

title: Hawaii School Data
text: Levels: State, Complex Area (15), School (~290) Demographics: Filipino, Native Hawaiian, White, Japanese, Pacific Islander, Mixed, others Special populations: English Learners (LEP), Special Education Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12

title: Hawaii School Data
text: Single statewide district: Hawaii local school districts Complex Areas: 15 geographic clusters centered around high schools Pacific Islander detail: granular Pacific Islander categories mainland states Mixed race: High rates multiracial students (30%+)

title: Detect format era for Hawaii data — detect_format_era

Use get_databook_year() map correctly.

title: Fetch Hawaii enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads returns enrollment data Hawaii Department Education (HIDOE) via DBEDT State Data Book.

title: Fetch Hawaii enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year School year end (2023-24 = 2024). See get_available_years() range available years. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch Hawaii enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data county grade

title: Fetch Hawaii enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year parameter uses standard convention: represents END school year. example: end_year = 2024 returns data 2023-24 school year end_year = 2025 returns data 2024-25 school year

title: Fetch Hawaii enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get 2025 enrollment data (2024-25 school year) enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Force fresh download enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE) } # }

what: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
text: Returns range years enrollment data can fetched Hawaii Department Education via DBEDT Data Book.

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list components: min_year Earliest available year (2011) max_year recent available year (2025) years Vector available years description Human-readable description date range

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
text: end_year parameter follows convention represents END year school year. example: end_year = 2024 means 2023-24 school year (ending June 2024) end_year = 2025 means 2024-25 school year (ending June 2025) Note data sources: DBEDT Data Books published annually typically contain enrollment data school year ends publication year. example, 2023 Data Book contains 2023-24 school year data (end_year=2024). Known gaps: end_year 2012 available (2011 Data Book published) end_year 2020 appears 2019 2020 Data Books (COVID impact)

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2011 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2025 #>  #> $years #>  [1] 2011 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Hawaii enrollment data is available for school years ending 2011 to 2025 (except 2012 - no 2011 Data Book published)" #>
